metadata.title: CVE-2021-35477 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel through 5.13.7, an unprivileged BPF program can obtainsensitive information from kernel memory via a Speculative Store Bypassside-channel attack because a certain preempting store operation does notnecessarily occur before a store operation that has an attacker-controlledvalue.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
